ADLXWrapper
Table of Contents

Class ADLXSystemServicesHelper

Namespace
ADLXWrapper
Assembly
ADLXWrapper.dll

Helper wrapper over IADLXSystem exposing per-feature service accessors and GPU enumeration.

public sealed class ADLXSystemServicesHelper : IDisposable
Inheritance
object
ADLXSystemServicesHelper
Implements
IDisposable
Inherited Members

object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Constructors

ADLXSystemServicesHelper(IADLXSystem*, bool)

Creates a system-services helper from an ADLX system pointer.

public ADLXSystemServicesHelper(IADLXSystem* system, bool addRef = false)

Parameters

system IADLXSystem*

Native ADLX system pointer.

addRef bool

Ignored; kept for API compatibility. IADLXSystem is not ref-counted.

Methods

Dispose()

Disposes cached COM pointers and releases references.

public void Dispose()

EnumerateADLXGPUs()

Enumerates GPU facades with display/desktop helpers wired in.

public IReadOnlyList<ADLXGPU> EnumerateADLXGPUs()

Returns

IReadOnlyList<ADLXGPU>

List of managed GPU facades. Callers must Dispose each GPU when finished.

Exceptions

ADLXException

If enumeration is unsupported or fails.

ObjectDisposedException

If the helper has been disposed.

Returns

If enumeration fails.

ObjectDisposedException

If the helper has been disposed.

GetSystemServicesNative()

Returns the most capable available system interface (IADLXSystem2, then 1, else base). Caller must not Release the returned pointer.

public IADLXSystem* GetSystemServicesNative()

Returns

IADLXSystem*

Native system interface pointer owned by this helper.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

If the helper has been disposed.

TryGet3DSettingsServicesNative(out IADLX3DSettingsServices*)

Tries to get the native 3D settings services interface without throwing when unsupported.

public bool TryGet3DSettingsServicesNative(out IADLX3DSettingsServices* services)

Parameters

services IADLX3DSettingsServices*

Returns

bool

True if services are available; false when not supported.
